Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Inadvertent disclosure of classified documents during immigration proceedings
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Potential compromise of national security information
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Unintentional release of sensitive government documents to applicant's counsel
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Failure in document redaction and handling procedures
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Official privilege claims upheld by court
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Court accepted the Minister’s claim of national security privilege
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Unauthorized access to confidential materials by counsel
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance between national security and procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 87
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Protection of information injurious to national security
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Motion granted: return and destruction of disclosed materials
Crimes.Outcome: Privilege upheld; documents ordered returned or destroyed
Crimes.Process: Judicial review of privilege and jurisdiction
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and handling of privileged material in litigation
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Correctness on jurisdiction, reasonableness on privilege

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadvertent breach of national security privilege
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Disclosure of unredacted national security documents to counsel
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Potential exposure of intelligence sources or methods
Crimes.Target_Entity: Applicant's legal counsel, Federal Court proceedings
Crimes.Organization_Involved: Minister of Public Safety / Government of Canada
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Lapse in protocol leading to unauthorized access
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether inadvertent disclosure waives national security privilege
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: High – verified through in camera review
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Documents confirmed as containing sensitive information
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Court found no waiver of privilege due to inadvertence
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Handling and retention of disclosed materials by third party
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Onus on Minister to justify non-disclosure under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 87
Crimes.Legal_Standard: National security privilege not automatically waived by inadvertent disclosure
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Jurisdiction affirmed; motion to recall granted
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Order issued for return or destruction of documents
Crimes.Process: Motion hearing with in camera document review
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Fairness to applicant vs. state interest in secrecy

Crimes.Crime_Name: Unauthorized disclosure of national security information
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Risk posed by dissemination of protected information outside authorized channels
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Potential exploitation by foreign entities or individuals of concern
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Failure to safeguard classified data during legal process
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Government承认失误 in document handling
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Negligent oversight in preparation of court materials
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Unauthorized possession of sensitive information by counsel
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Consistent classification markings and governmental assertion
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Preponderance of risk to national security outweighs openness
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 87
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Federal Court may issue non-disclosure orders to protect national security
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Order for return/destruction of disclosed documents
Crimes.Process: Ex parte and in camera proceedings considered
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Use of protective orders in immigration cases
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Right to full answer and defence limited by security concerns
